title: Cross-language sentiment analysis of {European} {Twitter} messages during the {COVID-19} pandemic
authors:
Kruspe, Anna  and
H{\"a}berle, Matthias  and
Kuhn, Iona  and
Zhu, Xiao Xiang
venue: Proceedings of the 1st Workshop on {NLP} for {COVID-19} at {ACL} 2020
abstract: In this paper, we analyze Twitter messages (tweets) collected during the first months of the COVID-19 pandemic in Europe with regard to their sentiment. This is implemented with a neural network for sentiment analysis using multilingual sentence embeddings. We separate the results by country of origin, and correlate their temporal development with events in those countries. This allows us to study the effect of the situation on peopleâ€™s moods. We see, for example, that lockdown announcements correlate with a deterioration of mood in almost all surveyed countries, which recovers within a short time span.
